Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ, 7 Sept 2023, 12:06 GMT+10

Hi Alyssa,

In response to the questions:

Is there anything that needs to be installed to better protect our sites to prevent something like this from happening again? Note that I did check with other online tracking tools as well which verified that it did indeed have malware before I reached out to you.

***There are paid tiers with Sucuri, but it's likely above and beyond what is required and can slow the site down due to extra security checks. We have further tightened the security on appledental.com.au by increasing the firewall protection and what it allows/blocks. I will also note, that in all the years that this site has been hosted by us, that it's the first incident of this kind. So we should not see a repeat.

Apologies, I didn’t meant the site was down – as in the malware was up and our Google Ads were down since the Friday, which means that the malware could’ve been on the site for longer than the Friday as that was only when Google Ads noticed it.

***This is possible, but unknown. Malcare did not pick it up prior, so it's unlikely. Sucuri must have found the same malware on other WordPress sites so was able to locate it sooner. These security networks rely on the detection of threats, then look for patterns and across many websites with similar configurations to determine if they have been breached. This is why we see some platforms pick up issues before others.

How did your systems not show that there was malware until I notified you? I just wanted to check when the daily schedule runs were for Malcare across all of our sites because it seemed to missed it from at least Friday to the Monday morning I notified you. We essentially just want to ensure that we are getting notifications as soon as this happens rather than having 3 full days of missed Ads and potential threat the website for longer.

***The MalCare checks are run daily during off-peak hours. It did fail to detect the malware in this instance. Which, again, is very odd. We use this exact setup on 100's of websites. If Malcare does detect malware, our team is alerted. We also have 3rd party dedication provided from our hostign company. Both didn't detect the malware, likely because it was not a true threat. We still have the free version of Sucuri installed on appledental.com.au. Any issues will be emailed to webmaster@nationaldentalcare.com.au. We can add additional emails if you like?



Thanks and speak soon,


![heath-maguire.png](https://wolfiq.com.au/email-sig/heath-maguire.png)
